content.title: What's the difference between mean and median?
content.summary: Mean is the arithmetic average of all values, while median is the middle value when data is sorted.

content.title: When should I use mean vs median?
content.summary: Use mean for normally distributed data without outliers. Use median for skewed data or when outliers are present.

content.title: What's the difference between sample and population standard deviation?
content.summary: Sample SD uses n-1 in the denominator for unbiased estimation, while population SD uses n when you have all data points.

content.title: What's the difference between weighted and unweighted GPA?
content.summary: Weighted GPA gives extra points for advanced courses, while unweighted GPA treats all courses equally on a 4.0 scale.

content.title: Strategic GPA Improvement: From 2.8 to 3.5 in Two Semesters
content.summary: Case study of a college student who strategically improved their GPA from 2.8 to 3.5 using data-driven course selection.
